Run_multiobjective_2030 Documentation

Pareto Optimization Plotting Module 2030

This module generates Pareto front plots by calling the pareto.multiobjective_optimization() function. Two main routines are provided: one to explore the trade-off between GHG emissions (as a constraint) and price, and another to explore the trade-off between human toxicity and GHG emissions.

author:

tghosh

run_multiobjective_2030.main()[source]

Perform multi-objective optimization with a constraint on GHG emissions and plot the Pareto front for GHG emissions vs. price.

The routine initializes optimization parameters, repeatedly calls pareto.multiobjective_optimization() while decreasing the GHG constraint, and stores the resulting objective values. Finally, it creates and saves a scatterplot that visualizes the trade-off between total GHG emissions and total price.

Returns:

None

run_multiobjective_2030.main2()[source]

Perform multi-objective optimization with a constraint on human toxicity and plot the Pareto front for human toxicity vs. GHG emissions.

This routine sets optimization parameters for human toxicity, calls the pareto.multiobjective_optimization() function repeatedly while reducing the human toxicity constraint, and collects the optimization results. It then creates a scatterplot that visualizes the trade-off between total human toxicity and total GHG emissions.

Returns:

None
